summary: Most requested frontend screens/components and ESP32 polling/command scaffolding appear to be implemented (Dashboard/Species/Settings navigation, circular gauges, /status polling every 3s, /manualTurn and /setMode hooks, local settings persistence, help/about kiosk instructions, static asset references). However, the diff also introduces Internet Identity/auth and IC actor plumbing that is not requested and conflicts with the non-goals.

hallucinated_features.description: Internet Identity authentication/user identity management and IC actor recreation logic (implies accounts/auth), which is explicitly a non-goal (no user accounts/authentication).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest non-goals forbid adding user accounts/authentication. Diff adds an InternetIdentityProvider, identity state, login/clear flows, and actor creation tied to identity.

hallucinated_features.description: Internet Computer backend actor integration scaffolding (createActorWithConfig / backendInterface usage) despite the frontend requirements focusing on direct ESP32 HTTP and not requiring canister actor calls.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by any REQ; ESP32 communication is specified as HTTP GET endpoints and the solution must not assume canister outcalls to ESP32. Adding actor plumbing is extraneous to the requested UI/ESP32 functionality.
